alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 07 at 1:15PM PST until March 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...The Winter Storm Warning is in effect for areas above 1500 feet. The Winter Weather Advisory is for areas between 500 and 1500 feet, including Carpenterville Highway and higher elevations along Highway 101. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will fluctuate between 1500 and 1800 feet this afternoon before lowering to the valley floors this evening and tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
